summary: The Election Results Accountability Act amends the Help America Vote Act of 2002 to establish deadlines for states to count ballots and certify election results for federal elections. States must count at least 90% of ballots within 72 hours of polls closing and certify results within two weeks. Exceptions are provided for emergencies, technical difficulties, new election procedures, and recounts. Non-compliance can lead to withholding of federal election administration funds. The bill also includes conforming and clerical amendments.
